docs.snippet: EXTENSIVE FIRE IN PLATT-STREET LOSS ABOUT 835,000. Between 1 and 2 o'clock yesterday morning a fire was discovered in the building No. 32 Plattstreet, occupied by GOUDELET  GOURE, dealers in  patent medicines, and S.J. PARDESSUS, manufacturer of...
docs.lead_paragraph: EXTENSIVE FIRE IN PLATT-STREET LOSS ABOUT 835,000. Between 1 and 2 o'clock yesterday morning a fire was discovered in the building No. 32 Plattstreet, occupied by GOUDELET GOURE, dealers in patent medicines, and S.J. PARDESSUS, manufacturer of glass-ware. The firemen quickly repaired to the place, but in spite of their earnest efforts to extinguish the flames, owing to the combustible character of the medicine stock,a large amount of damage was done.

docs.snippet: Arrived 4th, ship Challenge, New-York; 5th, Alarm Boston: ship Melor, Bordeaux; 6th, steamer Golden Age, having in tow the steamer John L. Stephens, which sailed hence 11th ult. for Panama. It will require two months and a cost of $30,000 to repair...
docs.lead_paragraph: Arrived 4th, ship Challenge, New-York; 5th, Alarm Boston: ship Melor, Bordeaux; 6th, steamer Golden Age, having in tow the steamer John L. Stephens, which sailed hence 11th ult. for Panama. It will require two months and a cost of $30,000 to repair the John L. Stephens. The passengers by the Golden Age arrived in good health, 25 days from New-York.

docs.snippet: Yankee land may well feel proud of this day's hospitality. Boston has entertained the Prince of Wales in a judicious and pleasing manner, to his entire satisfaction and greatly to her credit.

docs.snippet: To-day we are to hang a man, but probably not one in a hundred of our citizens know it. There has not a reporter been to see him since he was sentenced. Nobody has asked whether he has made a confession. Having requested that none but the priest and...

headline.main: CALIFORNIA.; Waste Meterial for a Sensation High Schools and Colleges Method of the City Reform Movement Killing an Assemblyman no Murder Oregon Sports and Political Aspects Pali Ute Protests Assessor's Statistics, & c., & c.

docs.lead_paragraph: To-day we are to hang a man, but probably not one in a hundred of our citizens know it. There has not a reporter been to see him since he was sentenced. Nobody has asked whether he has made a confession. Having requested that none but the priest and the Sisters of Mercy be permitted to visit him, his request has been complied with. We don't work up our sensations, you perceive, artistically.

headline.main: Great Republican Meeting at Auburn.; Speeches of Hon. W.M. Evarts and General Nye. What President Buchanan Thinks About Lincoln's Election. Southern Sentiment Relative to the Late Elections. POLITICS IN THE METROPOLIS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Republican mass meeting here to-day has been one of the largest demonstrations that has taken place in Central New-York during the canvass. The Wide-Awake procession was large and enthusiastic, and the meeting was one of unusual interest. Nearly ten thousand people were in attendance. Many were disappointed owing to the absence of Gov. SEWARD, but his letter stating the cause gave general satisfaction.
